from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals

import time
from havoc.autoval.lib.test_base import TestBase
import havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.utils as utils
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval_thread import AutovalThread
from havoc.autoval.lib.host.openbmc import OpenBMC



[docs]class HwcTest(TestBase):
    """
    Test autoval/lib/host/HWC class functionalities
    hwc mode is set through control file
    """
    # TODO: Library functions that have not been tested
    # set_next_boot
    # set_boot_order_ipv6
    # remediate time
    # watchdog: configure, start, stop
    # users: get, validate, sanitize


[docs]    def execute(self):
        self.test_power_status()
        self.test_get_sel_log()
        self.test_get_sensor_log()
        self.test_clearing_sel_log()
        self.test_power_off()
        self.test_power_on()
        self.test_bmc_reset()
        self.test_power_cycle()
        self.test_getting_bios_codes()



[docs]    def test_power_status(self):
        self.log_info("Check if server is powered on.")
        self.validate_condition(
            self.host.oob.check_powered_on(),
            "Device should be powered on"
        )



[docs]    def test_get_sel_log(self):
        self.log_info("Getting SEL log using hwc.")
        """
        Add a random string to log, then verify if it's there
        """
        random_str = utils.gen_random_string()
        if isinstance(self.host.oob.bmc, OpenBMC):
            # add_sel_message is only in OpenBMC
            # so this test might will fail for legacy systems
            self.host.oob.add_sel_message(random_str, True)
            log_dump = self.host.oob.log_message()
            found = False
            if utils.is_random_string_in_log(log_dump, random_str):
                found = True
            self.validate_condition(found, "Successfully retrieved system event log")
        else:
            # simpler test for legacy systems
            self.validate_no_exception(
                self.host.oob.log_message,
                [],
                "Getting log message without error."
            )



[docs]    def test_get_sensor_log(self):
        self.log_info("Test getting sensor log using hwc.")
        self.validate_no_exception(
            self.host.oob.sensor_data,
            [],
            "Get log successfully"
        )



[docs]    def test_power_off(self):
        self.log_info("Powering off the host.")
        self.host.oob.power_off()
        self.validate_condition(
            not self.host.oob.check_powered_on(),
            "Host should be powered off."
        )



[docs]    def test_power_on(self):
        self.log_info("Powering on the host.")
        self.host.oob.power_on()
        self.validate_condition(
            self.host.oob.check_powered_on(),
            "Host should be powered on."
        )



[docs]    def test_clearing_sel_log(self):
        """
        Add a random string to log. Then verify that it's not there
        after clearing
        """
        random_str = utils.gen_random_string()
        if isinstance(self.host.oob.bmc, OpenBMC):
            # add_sel_message is only in OpenBMC
            # so this test might will fail for legacy systems
            self.host.oob.add_sel_message(random_str, True)
            log_dump = self.host.oob.log_message()

            self.validate_condition(
                utils.is_random_string_in_log(log_dump, random_str),
                "Check if the generated string is added to log."
            )
            self.host.oob.sel_clear()
            log_dump = self.host.oob.log_message()

            self.validate_condition(
                not utils.is_random_string_in_log(log_dump, random_str),
                "Log is cleared"
            )
        else:
            # simpler test for legacy systems
            self.validate_no_exception(
                self.host.oob.sel_clear,
                [],
                "Getting log message without error."
            )



[docs]    def test_bmc_reset(self):
        """
        Reset BMC and test if it is pingable after a few minutes
        """
        self.log_info("Resetting BMC then verify.")
        q = []
        q.append(AutovalThread.start_autoval_thread(self.host.oob.reboot))
        q.append(AutovalThread.start_autoval_thread(self._validate_bmc_offline))
        AutovalThread.wait_for_autoval_thread(q)
        self.validate_condition(
            self.host.oob.ping_bmc(),
            "BMC should be pingable."
        )



[docs]    def test_power_cycle(self):
        """
        Perform a cycle test of different types
        """
        self.validate_no_exception(
            self.host.oob.cycle,
            [],
            "DC cyle test passed"
        )
        self.validate_no_exception(
            self.host.oob.ac_cycle,
            [],
            "AC cyle test passed"
        )
        self.validate_no_exception(
            self.host.oob.power_reset,
            [],
            "SLED cyle test passed"
        )
        self.validate_no_exception(
            self.host.oob.power_warm,
            [],
            "Warm cyle test passed"
        )



[docs]    def test_getting_bios_codes(self):
        # TODO: Elaborate test. Right now, it only runs to make sure
        # the function does not throw any error
        self.validate_no_exception(
            self.host.oob.get_bios_post_codes,
            [],
            "Getting bios post codes without error"
        )
        self.validate_no_exception(
            self.host.oob.get_bios_post_codes_parsed,
            [],
            "Getting bios post codes without error"
        )



[docs]    def _validate_bmc_offline(self, timeout=5):
        """
        Check if BMC is unreachable
        """
        time.sleep(30)
        self.validate_condition(
            not self.host.oob.ping_bmc(),
            "BMC should be offline"
        )



if __name__ == '__main__':
    test = HwcTest()
    test.lifecycle()
